condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.3. Child GovernanceBy 2020, an enabling environment for child rights governance that includes building the capacity of national institutions and civil society to advocate for children and advance child rights, while creatively designing avenues for children to participate in national policy discussions

description.narrative: Child Rights Governance continues to be a collaborative effort by both state and non- state actors across all sectors to ensure that children's rights are realized in Uganda. UNICEF is supporting the systematic and meaningful participation of children through the development of child friendly documents such as the UNICEF Country Programme Document 2021 – 2025 and the GoU's National Child Participation Strategy, while capturing the voices of children though the Child Rights TV Series as well as the VNR and SDG reporting processes. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/07/2020

title.narrative: Existence of domestic legislation and administrative guidance in accordance with the Concluding Observations of Committee on the Rights of the Child

baseline.value: Good: Some of the Committee observations/recommendations (30%-60%) have been taken into account through the domestic legislation and administrative guidance

target.value: 2020:Good: Some of the Committee observations/recommendations (30%-60%) have been taken into account through the domestic legislation and administrative guidance
